result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory T Lindsey

records.addlTxt: No Contact Order.  Signed and Filed.  nk

Defendant Gregory T Lindsey in court. Attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Branch PE. Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/20/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Gregory T Lindsey in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Counsel informs the Court that Defendant is entering an in-treatment patient care facility starting 8/23/2022 for six weeks and asks to waive time limits until October of 2022.
Court grants Defense's request and orders case set for a preliminary hearing in October. 
Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/18/22 @ 2p
